item.title: For an introduction to what it takes to build "context-aware reasoning applications" (the main goal of LangChain) check out @hwchase17's recent TED ta...
item.description:
For an introduction to what it takes to build "context-aware reasoning applications" (the main goal of LangChain) check out @hwchase17's recent TED talk

Dives into:

The 4 different ways to provide context to LLMs
The 6 different cognitive architectures

https://www.ted.com/talks/harrison_chase_the_magical_ai_assistants_of_the_future_and_the_engineering_behind_them

item.title: RT Ollama: It's toy time, Saturday! Day 9: AI Tamago is a tamagotchi-like game that has its thoughts and feelings generated via a LLM. It can be run l...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇOllama
It's toy time, Saturday! Day 9:

AI Tamago is a tamagotchi-like game that has its thoughts and feelings generated via a LLM.

It can be run locally, 100% Javascript-based, and costs $0 to run.

It's an amazing project by @stuffyokodraws

Source:
https://github.com/ykhli/AI-tamago

item.title: RT Lance Martin: Local multi-modal LLMs Multi-modal LLMs will be useful for tasks like image extraction, visual Q+A, etc. But running them locally / i...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇLance Martin
Local multi-modal LLMs

Multi-modal LLMs will be useful for tasks like image extraction, visual Q+A, etc. But running them locally / in private mode has been a challenge.

@OLLAMA just added support local / private multi-modal LLMs. E.g., see many version of LLaVA here that can‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1736107788039065623
